backend/main.mo: Motoko actor exposing three AI generation endpoints (screenplay, character profiles, production plan) that send prompts to the OpenAI chat completions API via HTTP outcalls, plus a transform function for response canonicalization.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (dashboard UI, PDF export, TXT export, cinematic theme) to their associated source files, components, and test IDs with confidence ratings.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of every frontend source file, serving as a quick reference index for the project's React components, hooks, utilities, and styles.
frontend/index.css: Base Tailwind CSS file defining OKLCH color tokens for light and dark themes across background, foreground, card, sidebar, and chart variables.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point for the Scriptoria Vite/React app, mounting the React root div and loading the main TSX module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root Scriptoria application component that orchestrates the hero section, idea input, parallel AI generation via useGenerateAll, content panels display, and success/error toast notifications within a QueryClientProvider.
frontend/src/components/CharacterProfile: Panel component that parses AI-generated character profile text into structured cards with color-coded avatars, role badges, and sectioned profile data (personality, backstory, motivation), with a shimmer skeleton loading state.
frontend/src/components/ContentPanels.ts: Container component that renders all three result panels (Screenplay, Characters, Production) as a tabbed interface on mobile and a three-column grid on desktop with cinematic card styling.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Renders the cinematic hero header with a background image, gradient overlays, film strip decorations, logo, title, and tagline for the Scriptoria app.
frontend/src/components/IdeaInput.tsx: Provides a textarea input for users to enter a film idea, with example idea chips, character count, and a generate button that triggers the onGenerate callback.
Exports animated shimmer skeleton components (ScreenplaySkeleton, CharactersSkeleton, ProductionPlanSkeleton) used as loading placeholders for each content panel.
frontend/src/components/ProductionPlanPa: Displays the generated production plan content with markdown-aware formatting (headings, bullets, numbered lists) and a download-as-TXT button.
Renders the generated screenplay with formatting for scene headings, character names, parentheticals, and dialogue, plus a PDF export button.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using React Query, supporting both authenticated (Internet Identity) and anonymous actors, and invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication on ICP, managing login/logout state, identity persistence, and AuthClient configuration.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines a `useGenerateAll` mutation hook that calls three backend actor methods (screenplay, character profiles, production plan) in parallel given a film idea string.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet importing Google Fonts and defining Tailwind base/component layers with a cinematic dark theme using gold and charcoal CSS custom properties.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped in QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/utils/pdfExport.ts: Exports a screenplay string as a formatted A4 PDF by dynamically loading jsPDF from CDN and applying scene-heading and character-name styling.
frontend/src/utils/textExport.ts: Exports a production plan string as a plain-text `.txt` file with a formatted header/footer, triggering a browser download via a Blob URL.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with cinematic gold/charcoal color palettes, film-inspired font families, custom shadows, gradients, and keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the current project state for Scriptoria, listing implemented features (dashboard, PDF export, production plan download, responsive UI, tabbed panels) and architectural notes about OpenAI-powered generation.
